definition: Mt Li near Xi'an with the tomb of the First Emperor
black horse/jet steed/good horse/legendary black dragon
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan

sentences.english: So very long ago, the Lishan Mountain was a already famous resort.
sentences.chinese: 驪山很早以前就是著名的旅遊勝地了。

sentences.english: The beautiful scenery of Lishan Mountain attracts a steady stream of visitors.
sentences.chinese: 驪山的美景吸引了絡繹不絕的遊人。

sentences.english: But do you know why it's called Lishan?
sentences.chinese: 你知道爲什麼叫驪山嗎？

sentences.english: Today, we are going to take our audience on a tour of the scenic Lishan Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 那我們今天呢就帶大家去飽覽一下驪山的美景。

sentences.english: Daniel, behind us is the Lishan Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，咱們身後的是驪山。

sentences.english: Mount Li is not just well-known for its picturesque scenery but also for its hot springs.
sentences.chinese: 驪山不僅以風光綺麗聞名，更有溫泉著稱。

definition: old place name (in Yan of Warring states, in modern Beijing city)
marble pillar (ornamental column in front of places, tombs)
palace
Buddha/Buddhist stupa (transliteration of Pali thupo)/also written 浮屠
watchtower on either side of a city gate/(literary) city/imperial palace
ship with several decks/turreted junk
southern states of Wu and Chu/the middle and lower Yangtze valley
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
marshes/swamps
Longsha district of Qiqihar city 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
bejeweled jade palace (idiom); sumptuous dwelling
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
open grassland
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
fairyland/honorific: your homeland
